actor

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • actor.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Hobbit, Nazgul, Orc, Wizard 

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Actor class is the super class for all different types of Actor subclasses. The Actor class tracks state information for individual actors in the simulation: name, health, strength, speed, etc (and later, a screen avatar with coordinates). Additional attributes are tracked in the subclasses. The behaviours (moving and battling) are defined in the subclasses. Actor class is currently a concrete class. Later, the Actor class will become an abstract class where no Actor objects will ever be created -- only subclass objects.
    Author:
    Calvin Li
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor()
        Actor constructor is used to create Actor objects automatically. It gives them randomly generated values for name, health, strength and speed.

      • Actor

        public Actor(Army armyAllegiance)
        Actor constructor is used to create Actor objects automatically. It gives them randomly generated values for name, health, strength and speed. It takes a parameter armyAllegiance.
        Parameters:
        armyAllegiance - This is used to return the army it belongs to.
